classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), B1-B5 elective, C1, C2, C3, C4, D1, D3, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). One (1) course must be completed from B1, in addition to STAT 217. No SOC class may be taken to fulfill GE D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Select from the following: ES 340; ES/WGS 350; POLS 310, 343, 419, 459, 471; POLS/UNIV 333; PSY 310, 318, 330; PSY/CD 306; SOC 306, 309, 310, 402, 406, 412; WGS 301, 401; WGS/RELS 370.

If GE courses are taken for a letter grade and used as concentration electives, additional Free Electives may be required to complete the 180 total degree requirement. See College Advisor for additional information.

Note: Check Tentative Course Offerings to see when certain classes are available, and plan accordingly.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
